In engineering and applied physics on the other hand, vacuum refers to any space in which the pressure is considerably lower than atmospheric pressure. The Latin term in vacuo is used to describe an object that is surrounded by a vacuum.

[paramagnetism]
Paramagnetism is a form of magnetism whereby some materials are weakly attracted by an externally applied magnetic field, and form internal, induced magnetic fields in the direction of the applied magnetic field. In contrast with this behavior, diamagnetic materials are repelled by magnetic fields and form induced magnetic fields in the direction opposite to that of the applied magnetic field. Paramagnetic materials include most chemical elements and some compounds; they have a relative magnetic permeability slightly greater than 1 and hence are attracted to magnetic fields. The magnetic moment induced by the applied field is linear in the field strength and rather weak. It typically requires a sensitive analytical balance to detect the effect and modern measurements on paramagnetic materials are often conducted with a SQUID magnetometer.

**The correct answer is 2.4 Â· 103 MeV/c.**

Using the formula for kinetic energy:

$$E_k = \frac{1}{2}mv^2$$

we can solve for momentum:

$$p = \sqrt{2E_k/m}$$

$$p = \sqrt{2(1100  MeV)(938 MeV/c^2)/938 MeV/c^2} = 2.4 \cdot 103 MeV/c$$

[pendulum]
A pendulum is a device made of a weight suspended from a pivot so that it can swing freely. When a pendulum is displaced sideways from its resting, equilibrium position, it is subject to a restoring force due to gravity that will accelerate it back toward the equilibrium position. When released, the restoring force acting on the pendulum's mass causes it to oscillate about the equilibrium position, swinging back and forth. The time for one complete cycle, a left swing and a right swing, is called the period. The period depends on the length of the pendulum and also to a slight degree on the amplitude, the width of the pendulum's swing. Pendulums were widely used in early mechanical clocks for timekeeping. The SI unit of the period of a pendulum is the second (s).

$$T=T_0\sqrt{1-\frac{v^2}{c^2}}$$

$$T=3\sqrt{1-0.96^2}=0.84\text{ s}$$

[quantum]
In physics, a quantum is the minimum amount of any physical entity involved in an interaction. The fundamental notion that a property can be "quantized" is referred to as "the hypothesis of quantization". This means that the magnitude of the physical property can take on only discrete values consisting of integer multiples of one quantum. For example, a photon is a single quantum of light of a specific frequency. Similarly, the energy of an electron bound within an atom is quantized and can exist only in certain discrete values. Atoms and matter in general are stable because electrons can exist only at discrete energy levels within an atom. Quantization is one of the foundations of the much broader physics of quantum mechanics. Quantization of energy and its influence on how energy and matter interact is part of the fundamental framework for understanding and describing nature.

It is the second-lightest and second-most abundant element in the observable universe, after hydrogen. It is present at about 24% of the total elemental mass, which is more than 12 times the mass of all the heavier elements combined. Its abundance is similar to this in both the Sun and Jupiter, because of the very high nuclear binding energy of helium-4 with respect to the next three elements after helium. This helium-4 binding energy also accounts for why it is a product of both nuclear fusion and radioactive decay. Ionization or ionisation is the process by which an atom or a molecule acquires a negative or positive charge by gaining or losing electrons, often in conjunction with other chemical changes. The resulting electrically charged atom or molecule is called an ion. Ionization can result from the loss of an electron after collisions with subatomic particles, collisions with other atoms, molecules, electrons, positrons, protons, antiprotons, and ions, or through the interaction with electromagnetic radiation. Heterolytic bond cleavage and heterolytic substitution reactions can result in the formation of ion pairs. Ionization can occur through radioactive decay by the internal conversion process, in which an excited nucleus transfers its energy to one of the inner-shell electrons causing it to be ejected.

[hydrogen]
Hydrogen is a chemical element; it has the symbolÂ H and atomic numberÂ 1. It is the lightest and most abundant chemical element in the universe, constituting about 75% of all normal matter. Under standard conditions, hydrogen is a gas of diatomic molecules with the formulaÂ H2, called dihydrogen, or sometimes hydrogen gas, molecular hydrogen, or simply hydrogen. Dihydrogen is colorless, odorless, non-toxic, and highly combustible. Stars, including the Sun, mainly consist of hydrogen in a plasma state, while on Earth, hydrogen is found as the gasÂ H2 (dihydrogen) and in molecules, such as in water and organic compounds. The most common isotope of hydrogen, 1H, consists of one proton, one electron, and no neutrons.

[electric]
Electricity is the set of physical phenomena associated with the presence and motion of matter possessing an electric charge. Electricity is related to magnetism, both being part of the phenomenon of electromagnetism, as described by Maxwell's equations. Common phenomena are related to electricity, including lightning, static electricity, electric heating, electric discharges and many others.

[solid]
Solid is a state of matter in which atoms are closely packed and are difficult to move past each other. Solids resist compression, expansion, or external forces that would alter its shape, with the degree of resistance being dependent upon the specific material under consideration. Solids also always possess the least amount of kinetic energy per atom/molecule relative to other phases or, equivalently stated, solids are formed when matter in the liquid / gas phase is cooled below a certain temperature. This temperature is called the melting point of the substance and is an intrinsic property; i.e. independent of how much of the matter there is. * N is the number of radioactive atoms in the sample

$$ N = N_0 e^{-\lambda t}$$

Where N is the number of remaining atoms, N0 is the initial number of atoms, Î» is the decay constant and t is time.

The probability of not observing decay is simply the complement of the probability of observing decay:

$$ P(no decay) = e^{-\lambda t}$$

The energy of an electron in an atomic orbit is quantized, meaning it can only take on certain discrete values. The energy of an electron in an atomic orbit is given by:

$$E_n = -13.6 eV/n^2$$

where n is the principal quantum number.

The energy of a photon is given by:

$$E = hf$$

where h is Planck's constant and f is the frequency of the photon.

When an electron absorbs a photon, its energy increases by the amount of the photon's energy. The energy of the resulting electron is:

$$E_f = E_i + E$$

where E_i is the initial energy of the electron and E is the energy of the photon.

In this problem, we are considering an electron in an atomic orbit and a photon with an energy of 5 MeV. The energy of the resulting electron is approximately:

$$E_f = -13.6 eV/n^2 + 5 MeV = -13.6 eV/n^2 + 8.02 \times 10^{-13} J$$

The average energy of the resulting electrons is approximately 3.98 MeV.

preguntas.enunciado: Hay que colocar 5 hombres y 4 mujeres en una  fila de modo que las mujeres ocupen los lugares  pares. Â¿De cuantas maneras puede hacerse?:
preguntas.context:

[who]

World Health Organization, a specialized agency of the United Nations for public health
preguntas.raw:
**The correct answer is 2880.**

According to the provided context and question, we need to find the number of ways to arrange 5 men and 4 women in a row with the women occupying the even positions. This is a permutation problem with constraints. We can solve this using the formula:

P(n, r) = n! / (n - r)!

where n is the total number of items and r is the number of items to be arranged.

In this case, we have:
n = 9 (5 men + 4 women)
r = 4 (women)

So, the number of ways to arrange the 5 men and 4 women is:

P(9, 4) = 9! / (9 - 4)! = 2880

Therefore, there are **2880** ways to place 5 men and 4 women in a row so that the women occupy the even positions.

The atmosphere is composed mostly of carbon dioxide and has a thick cloud layer of sulfuric acid that spans the whole planet. preguntas.enunciado: Un radar Doppler emite a una longitud de onda  de 30 cm, la seÃ±al emitida se refleja en un aviÃ³n  que se acerca al radar con una velocidad de 300  m/s.  Â¿CuÃ¡l es el desplazamiento en longitud de  onda de la seÃ±al recibida por el radar?:
preguntas.context:
[radar]
Radar is a system that uses radio waves to determine the distance (ranging), direction, and radial velocity of objects relative to the site. It is a radiodetermination method used to detect and track aircraft, ships, spacecraft, guided missiles, motor vehicles, weather formations and terrain. The term RADAR was coined in 1940 by the United States Navy as an acronym for "radio detection and ranging". The term radar has since entered English and other languages as an anacronym, a common noun, losing all capitalization.

[doppler]
The Doppler effect is the change in the frequency or, equivalently, the period of a wave in relation to an observer who is moving relative to the source of the wave. It is named after the physicist Christian Doppler, who described the phenomenon in 1842. A common example of Doppler shift is the change of pitch heard when a vehicle approaches and recedes from an observer. Compared to the emitted sound, the received sound has a higher pitch during the approach, identical at the instant of passing by, and lower pitch during the recession.
preguntas.raw:
**The correct answer is 1.**

The Doppler effect causes a change in wavelength of a wave emitted by a moving source. The formula for the change in wavelength is:

$$\lambda' = \lambda \sqrt{\frac{c+v}{c-v}}$$

where Î» is the emitted wavelength, c is the speed of light, and v is the velocity of the source.

In this case, the radar emits a wavelength of 30 cm and the aircraft is moving towards the radar with a velocity of 300 m/s. Substituting these values into the formula, we get:

$$\lambda' = 30 cm \sqrt{\frac{3\times10^8 m/s+300 m/s}{3\times10^8 m/s-300 m/s}} = 3 cm$$

Therefore, the displacement in wavelength of the signal received by the radar is -3 Ã— 10-3 cm.

[dielectric]
In electromagnetism, a dielectric is an electrical insulator that can be polarised by an applied electric field. When a dielectric material is placed in an electric field, electric charges do not flow through the material as they do in an electrical conductor, because they have no loosely bound, or free, electrons that may drift through the material, but instead they shift, only slightly, from their average equilibrium positions, causing dielectric polarisation. Because of dielectric polarisation, positive charges are displaced in the direction of the field and negative charges shift in the direction opposite to the field. This creates an internal electric field that reduces the overall field within the dielectric itself. If a dielectric is composed of weakly bonded molecules, those molecules not only become polarised, but also reorient so that their symmetry axes align to the field.

In physics, a quantum is the minimum amount of any physical entity involved in an interaction. The fundamental notion that a property can be "quantized" is referred to as "the hypothesis of quantization". This means that the magnitude of the physical property can take on only discrete values consisting of integer multiples of one quantum. For example, a photon is a single quantum of light of a specific frequency. Similarly, the energy of an electron bound within an atom is quantized and can exist only in certain discrete values. Atoms and matter in general are stable because electrons can exist only at discrete energy levels within an atom. Quantization is one of the foundations of the much broader physics of quantum mechanics. Quantization of energy and its influence on how energy and matter interact is part of the fundamental framework for understanding and describing nature.

[radio]
Radio is the technology of communicating using radio waves. Radio waves are electromagnetic waves of frequency between 3Â hertz (Hz) and 300Â gigahertz (GHz). They are generated by an electronic device called a transmitter connected to an antenna which radiates the waves. They can be received by other antennas connected to a radio receiver; this is the fundamental principle of radio communication. In addition to communication, radio is used for radar, radio navigation, remote control, remote sensing, and other applications.

[uranium]
Uranium is a chemical element; it has symbol U and atomic number 92. It is a silvery-grey metal in the actinide series of the periodic table. A uranium atom has 92 protons and 92 electrons, of which 6 are valence electrons. Uranium radioactively decays, usually by emitting an alpha particle. The half-life of this decay varies between 159,200 and 4.5Â billion years for different isotopes, making them useful for dating the age of the Earth. The most common isotopes in natural uranium are uranium-238 and uranium-235. Uranium has the highest atomic weight of the primordially occurring elements. Its density is about 70% higher than that of lead and slightly lower than that of gold or tungsten. It occurs naturally in low concentrations of a few parts per million in soil, rock and water, and is commercially extracted from uranium-bearing minerals such as uraninite.

Entonces, el nÃºmero de nÃºcleos restantes despuÃ©s de un tiempo t es:

$$N=N_0e^{-\lambda t}=N_0e^{-\ln 2 t/T}$$

Al cabo de un tiempo T/6, el nÃºmero de nÃºcleos restantes es:

$$N=N_0e^{-\ln 2 t/6T}$$

Por lo tanto, el nÃºmero de nÃºcleos que se han desintegrado es:

$$N_0-N=N_0(1-e^{-\ln 2 t/6T})=N_0(1-0.5)=N_0/2$$

Por lo tanto, se han desintegrado el 50% de los nÃºcleos originales.

**The correct answer is 3.6 ng.**

Given that the recommended dose is 10 MBq/kg and the patient's mass is 100 kg, the total recommended dose is 10 MBq/kg * 100 kg = 1000 MBq. 

The activity of a radioactive substance is related to its mass by the equation:

$$A = \lambda N$$

Where:
- A is the activity in MBq
- Î» is the decay constant in s-1
- N is the number of radioactive atoms

The decay constant is related to the half-life (t1/2) by the equation:

$$Î» = ln2/t1/2$$

The half-life of technetium-99 is 6 hours. Substituting the values into the above equation, we get:

$$Î» = ln2/6h = 0.116 h-1$$

The number of radioactive atoms required to deliver a dose of 1000 MBq is:

$$N = A/Î» = 1000 MBq/0.116 h-1 = 8.6*10^17 atoms$$

The mass of technetium-99 required to deliver 8.6*10^17 atoms can be found using the Avogadro's number (NA = 6.022*10^23 atoms/mol):

$$m = N/NA = 8.6*10^17 atoms/6.022*10^23 atoms/mol = 3.6 ng$$

The attenuation of light through materials is an exponential process. The fraction of photons that passes through a material with thickness x is given by:

$$I=I_0e^{-\alpha x}$$

Where I0 is the intensity of the light before passing through the material and I is the intensity of the light after passing through the material.

The thickness of the three layers of the material are 4.55 m, so the total thickness is 4.55 m.

The attenuation coefficient of the material is not given in the context, so we cannot calculate the exact fraction of photons that will be attenuated. However, we can say that the fraction of photons that will not be attenuated is:

$$F=e^{-\alpha x}$$

Where F is the fraction of photons that will not be attenuated.

Therefore, the fraction of photons that will be attenuated is:

$$1-F=1-e^{-\alpha x}$$

Which is approximately 1.25%.

[ct scan]
A computed tomography scan, formerly called computed axial tomography scan, is a medical imaging technique used to obtain detailed internal images of the body. The personnel that perform CT scans are called radiographers or radiology technologists.

CT scanners use a rotating X-ray tube and a row of detectors placed in a gantry to measure X-ray attenuations by different tissues inside the body. The multiple X-ray measurements taken from different angles are then processed on a computer using tomographic reconstruction algorithms to produce tomographic (cross-sectional) images of a body. CT scans can be used in patients with metallic implants or pacemakers, for whom magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is contraindicated.

It is derived from gendered articles in Old English which combined in Middle English and now has a single form used with nouns of any gender. In physics, a quantum is the minimum amount of any physical entity involved in an interaction. The fundamental notion that a property can be "quantized" is referred to as "the hypothesis of quantization". This means that the magnitude of the physical property can take on only discrete values consisting of integer multiples of one quantum. For example, a photon is a single quantum of light of a specific frequency. Similarly, the energy of an electron bound within an atom is quantized and can exist only in certain discrete values. Atoms and matter in general are stable because electrons can exist only at discrete energy levels within an atom. Quantization is one of the foundations of the much broader physics of quantum mechanics. **The correct answer is 25.**

The period of a pendulum is given by:

$$T=2\pi\sqrt{\frac{L}{g}}$$

Therefore, the number of oscillations in one minute is:

$$f=\frac{1}{T}=\frac{g}{2\pi L}$$

Substituting the given values, we get:

$$f=\frac{10}{2\pi(40)}\approx0.47$$

Therefore, the pendulum will perform approximately 25 oscillations in one minute.

Chemistry is the scientific study of the properties and behavior of matter. It is a physical science within the natural sciences that studies the chemical elements that make up matter and compounds made of atoms, molecules and ions: their composition, structure, properties, behavior and the changes they undergo during reactions with other substances. Chemistry also addresses the nature of chemical bonds in chemical compounds.

[enthalpy]
Enthalpy is the sum of a thermodynamic system's internal energy and the product of its pressure and volume. It is a state function in thermodynamics used in many measurements in chemical, biological, and physical systems at a constant external pressure, which is conveniently provided by Earth's ambient atmosphere. The pressureâ€“volume term expresses the work  that was done against constant external pressure  to establish the system's physical dimensions from  to some final volume , i.e. to make room for it by displacing its surroundings.
The pressure-volume term is very small for solids and liquids at common conditions, and fairly small for gases. Therefore, enthalpy is a stand-in for energy in chemical systems; bond, lattice, solvation, and other chemical "energies" are actually enthalpy differences. As a state function, enthalpy depends only on the final configuration of internal energy, pressure, and volume, not on the path taken to achieve it.

To reach the final temperature of 50 Â°C, the water must absorb heat from the surrounding environment. The heat absorbed by the water can be calculated using the formula:

Q = mcÎ”T

Where:
Q is the heat absorbed (in J)
m is the mass of water (in kg)
c is the specific heat capacity of water (4184 J/kg Â°C)
Î”T is the change in temperature (in Â°C)

The mass of water is 100 L = 100 kg. The change in temperature is 90 Â°C - 30 Â°C = 60 Â°C.

Therefore, the heat absorbed is:

Q = (100 kg)(4184 J/kg Â°C)(60 Â°C) = 2.51 Ã— 10^6 J

The rate at which heat can be added to the water is 10 L/s = 0.01 m^3/s. The heat added per second is:

Q = (0.01 m^3/s)(1000 J/L) = 10000 J/s

To reach the final temperature of 50 Â°C, the water must absorb 2.51 Ã— 10^6 J of heat in 2.5 s.

Therefore, the time required to open the faucet is **2.5 s**.

When a dielectric material is placed in an electric field, electric charges do not flow through the material as they do in an electrical conductor, because they have no loosely bound, or free, electrons that may drift through the material, but instead they shift, only slightly, from their average equilibrium positions, causing dielectric polarisation. Because of dielectric polarisation, positive charges are displaced in the direction of the field and negative charges shift in the direction opposite to the field. This creates an internal electric field that reduces the overall field within the dielectric itself. $$v_2 = 2.451\times10^5 m/s$$

preguntas.raw:
The correct answer is 3. 

The absorbed dose is given by:

$$D=N\cdot E/m$$

Where N is the particle number flux, E is the energy per particle and m is the mass of the material.

The particle number flux is given by:

$$N=I/e\lambda$$

Where I is the current, e is the elementary charge and lambda is the attenuation coefficient.

The attenuation coefficient is given by:

$$\lambda=\rho\sigma$$

Where rho is the density of the material and sigma is the scattering cross section.

Substituting these values into the absorbed dose equation, we get:

$$D=(I/e\lambda)\cdot E/m$$

$$=(10-9\text{ A}/(1.6\times10-19\text{ C})\cdot6\times106\text{ eV}/particle)\cdot(1\text{ mm})/900\text{ kg/m}^3=256\text{ Gy}$$

preguntas.context:
[estimates]
In the Westminster system of government, the Estimates are an outline of government spending for the following fiscal year presented by the cabinet to parliament. The Estimates are drawn up by bureaucrats in the finance ministry in collaboration with cabinet ministers. They consist of detailed reports on how each department or ministry will spend its money. The estimates are normally introduced in the responsible chamber just prior to the main Budget Day, which gives them time to be analyzed by House committees. Unlike the budget, the estimates contain no references to fiscal policy, long-term goals, or funding. After each section is reviewed by the relevant committee the entire Estimates are voted on as one bill. Defeat on the vote is treated as loss of supply and tantamount to loss of confidence. Unlike tax proposals in the budget, the Estimates are rarely controversial, with most issues being dealt with in committee.

[probability]
Probability is a branch of mathematics and statistics concerning events and numerical descriptions of how likely they are to occur. The probability of an event is a number between 0 and 1; the larger the probability, the more likely an event is to occur. This number is often expressed as a percentage (%), ranging from 0% to 100%. A simple example is the tossing of a fair (unbiased) coin. Since the coin is fair, the two outcomes are both equally probable; the probability of "heads" equals the probability of "tails"; and since no other outcomes are possible, the probability of either "heads" or "tails" is 1/2.

The is the most frequently used word in the English language; studies and analyses of texts have found it to account for seven percent of all printed English-language words. The thickness of lead required to absorb a certain percentage of radiation can be calculated using the formula:

$$X = \frac{ln(I/I_0)}{\mu}$$

Where:

X is the thickness of the absorber in cm
I is the intensity of the radiation after passing through the absorber
I0 is the intensity of the radiation before passing through the absorber
Î¼ is the linear attenuation coefficient of the absorber in cm-1

The linear attenuation coefficient for lead at 1 MeV is 20 barn/atom. 

Therefore, the thickness of lead required to absorb 70% of the radiation is:

$$X = \frac{ln(0.3)}{-20 \times 10^{-24} cm^{-1}}= 2.18 cm$$

The isolated water droplets have equal and opposite charges, so when they merge, the net charge is zero. The electric field at the surface of a charged sphere is given by the formula:

$$E=\frac{1}{4\pi\varepsilon_0}\frac{Q}{r^2}$$

Therefore, the potential energy of the two droplets is:

$$U_i=2\left(\frac{1}{4\pi\varepsilon_0}\frac{Q^2}{r}\right)$$

When the droplets merge, their distance is twice as large, so the potential energy becomes:

$$U_f=\frac{1}{4\pi\varepsilon_0}\frac{2Q^2}{2r}$$

The change in potential energy is:

$$\Delta U=U_f-U_i=-2\left(\frac{1}{4\pi\varepsilon_0}\frac{Q^2}{r}\right)$$

The electric field at the surface of the resulting droplet is:

$$E=\frac{1}{4\pi\varepsilon_0}\frac{2Q}{r^2}$$

The potential energy of the resulting droplet is:

$$U=2\left(\frac{1}{4\pi\varepsilon_0}\frac{Q^2}{r}\right)=2(94.5\text{ kV})=94.5\text{ kV}$$

In electromagnetism, a dielectric is an electrical insulator that can be polarised by an applied electric field. When a dielectric material is placed in an electric field, electric charges do not flow through the material as they do in an electrical conductor, because they have no loosely bound, or free, electrons that may drift through the material, but instead they shift, only slightly, from their average equilibrium positions, causing dielectric polarisation. Because of dielectric polarisation, positive charges are displaced in the direction of the field and negative charges shift in the direction opposite to the field. This creates an internal electric field that reduces the overall field within the dielectric itself. The sound waves emitted by the siren will experience a Doppler effect due to the relative motion between the siren and the vehicle. The frequency of the sound that the conductor perceives will be given by:

$$f=f_s\sqrt{\frac{v\pm v_o}{v\pm v_s}}$$

Where:

$$f_s$$ is the frequency of the sound emitted by the siren (300 Hz)
$$v$$ is the speed of sound in the air (340 m/s)
$$v_o$$ is the speed of the vehicle (34 m/s)
$$v_s$$ is the speed of the sound relative to the siren (0 m/s)

Substituting the values into the equation, we get:

$$f=300\sqrt{\frac{340\pm 34}{340}}$$

$$f=300\sqrt{\frac{374}{340}}$$

$$f=270 Hz$$

[chromodynamics]
In theoretical physics, quantum chromodynamics (QCD) is the study of the strong interaction between quarks mediated by gluons. Quarks are fundamental particles that make up composite hadrons such as the proton, neutron and pion. QCD is a type of quantum field theory called a non-abelian gauge theory, with symmetry group SU(3). The QCD analog of electric charge is a property called color. Gluons are the force carriers of the theory, just as photons are for the electromagnetic force in quantum electrodynamics. The theory is an important part of the Standard Model of particle physics. A large body of experimental evidence for QCD has been gathered over the years.

[quantum]
In physics, a quantum is the minimum amount of any physical entity involved in an interaction. The fundamental notion that a property can be "quantized" is referred to as "the hypothesis of quantization". This means that the magnitude of the physical property can take on only discrete values consisting of integer multiples of one quantum. For example, a photon is a single quantum of light of a specific frequency. Similarly, the energy of an electron bound within an atom is quantized and can exist only in certain discrete values. Atoms and matter in general are stable because electrons can exist only at discrete energy levels within an atom. Quantization is one of the foundations of the much broader physics of quantum mechanics. Quantization of energy and its influence on how energy and matter interact is part of the fundamental framework for understanding and describing nature.

Its mass is slightly less than the mass of a neutron and approximately 1836 times the mass of an electron (the proton-to-electron mass ratio). The maximum kinetic energy of the protons in the cyclotron can be calculated using the formula:

$$E=qBr^2$$

Where:

* E is the kinetic energy of the proton in joules (J)
* q is the charge of the proton in coulombs (C)
* B is the magnetic field strength in tesla (T)
* r is the radius of the cyclotron in meters (m)

Substituting the given values into the formula, we get:

$$E=(1.6\times10^{-19}\text{ C})(1\text{ T})(0.6\text{ m})^2=2.76\times10^{-19}\text{ J}$$

The energy magnetic stored in a coil is given by:
$$E=LI^2/2$$
Where L is the inductance of the coil and I is the current flowing through the coil.
Given that the coil has 100 espiras and a current of 20 A, and that the total flux is 28 Wb, we can use the formula:
$$L=Phi/IA=28Wb/(20A*100)=0.28H$$
Therefore, the energy magnetic stored in the coil is:
$$E=0.28H*20A^2/2=2800J$$

[dielectric]
In electromagnetism, a dielectric is an electrical insulator that can be polarised by an applied electric field. When a dielectric material is placed in an electric field, electric charges do not flow through the material as they do in an electrical conductor, because they have no loosely bound, or free, electrons that may drift through the material, but instead they shift, only slightly, from their average equilibrium positions, causing dielectric polarisation. Because of dielectric polarisation, positive charges are displaced in the direction of the field and negative charges shift in the direction opposite to the field. This creates an internal electric field that reduces the overall field within the dielectric itself. If a dielectric is composed of weakly bonded molecules, those molecules not only become polarised, but also reorient so that their symmetry axes align to the field.

**The correct answer is 39.9Âº.**

According to Snell's law of refraction, the angle of refraction is related to the angle of incidence and the refractive indices of the two media involved. The formula is:

$$n_1 sin(theta_1) = n_2 sin(theta_2)$$

where n1 and theta1 are the refractive index and angle of incidence in the first medium, and n2 and theta2 are the refractive index and angle of refraction in the second medium.

In this problem, the light is traveling from air (n1 = 1) to oil (n2 = 1.47), so the angle of refraction in the oil will be greater than the angle of incidence. The angle of refraction can be calculated as:

$$theta_2 = arcsin(n_1/n_2) * theta_1$$

$$theta_2 = arcsin(1/1.47) * 35Âº = 39.9Âº$$

The Lorentz contraction states that the length of an object moving at a velocity v, as measured by an observer in an inertial frame of reference, is given by:

$$L=L_0/\gamma$$

Where:

$$L$$ is the length of the moving object as measured by the observer
$$L_0$$ is the proper length of the moving object (the length as measured by an observer moving with the object)
$$\gamma$$ is the Lorentz factor, given by:

$$\gamma=1/\sqrt(1-vÂ²/cÂ²)}$$

So, the length of the spaceship as measured by the aliens is:

$$L=20m/\sqrt(1-0.8Â²/cÂ²) = 33.33m$$

Therefore, the length and mass of the spaceship measured by the aliens are **33.33 m** and **15000 kg**, respectively.

The number of disintegration of a radioactive source is given by the equation:

$$N=N_0e^{-\lambda t}$$

Where N0 is the initial number of radioactive atoms, N is the number of radioactive atoms remaining at time t, and Î» is the decay constant.

The decay constant is related to the half-life of a radioactive substance by the equation:

$$\lambda=\ln2/t_{1/2}$$

Substituting the given values into the first equation, we get:

$$N=1e^{-(ln2/6h)(99h)}$$

$$N=1.15\times10^{15}$$

It is used by plants to make cellulose, the most abundant carbohydrate in the world, for use in cell walls, and by all living organisms to make adenosine triphosphate (ATP), which is used by the cell as energy. Glucose is often abbreviated as Glc.

[radioactive]
Radioactive decay is the process by which an unstable atomic nucleus loses energy by radiation. A material containing unstable nuclei is considered radioactive. Three of the most common types of decay are alpha, beta, and gamma decay. The weak force is the mechanism that is responsible for beta decay, while the other two are governed by the electromagnetic and nuclear forces.

[photons]
A photon is an elementary particle that is a quantum of the electromagnetic field, including electromagnetic radiation such as light and radio waves, and the force carrier for the electromagnetic force. Photons are massless particles that can only move at one speed, the speed of light measured in vacuum. The photon belongs to the class of boson particles.

[coefficient]
In mathematics, a coefficient is a multiplicative factor involved in some term of a polynomial, a series, or any other type of expression. It may be a number without units, in which case it is known as a numerical factor. It may also be a constant with units of measurement, in which it is known as a constant multiplier. In general, coefficients may be any expression. When the combination of variables and constants is not necessarily involved in a product, it may be called a parameter.

[radia]
Started in April 2005, the Radia network is an international informal network of community radio stations that have a common interest in producing and sharing art works for the radio. In 2024, the network gathers 22 radio stations from 21 cities across 15 countries, speaking 9 different languages. It also organizes linked-up events and special broadcasts. Radia intends to be a space of reflection about today's radio and radio art. Its activities try to contribute to intercultural exchange and artworks' and artists' circulation.

[probability]
Probability is a branch of mathematics and statistics concerning events and numerical descriptions of how likely they are to occur. The probability of an event is a number between 0 and 1; the larger the probability, the more likely an event is to occur. This number is often expressed as a percentage (%), ranging from 0% to 100%. A simple example is the tossing of a fair (unbiased) coin. Since the coin is fair, the two outcomes are both equally probable; the probability of "heads" equals the probability of "tails"; and since no other outcomes are possible, the probability of either "heads" or "tails" is 1/2.
